cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then expected to bend westward skirting the Louisiana shoreline through Tuesday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Morgan City

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coast from Morgan City eastward to Ocean Springs, MS and adjacent inland areas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds with gusts 40–50 mph possible at the port beginning Monday afternoon.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge may propagate up the lower Mississippi River but is not expected to exceed 3 ft at the port’s location.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 3–6 inches with localized higher totals, producing flash and urban flooding around Port of Greater Baton Rouge.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous river currents may briefly affect cargo handling and vessel movements.
